_header: By that the Manciple had his tale all ended
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the the Parson’s Prologue of the Canterbury Tales — 74 lines in rhyming couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
By that the Maunciple had his tale endedethe sonne fro the southe
                    side is descendede…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…beth fructuous & that in litel spaceand to do wel god
                    send yow his grace
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And / next folwynge the person seith his Prolog (f. 267); the
                    persons prolog (RT); Here endith the Person his prolog And / next folowyng
                    bigynneth his tale (f. 268)

Bod414.First Lines:
[B]E that the maunciple had his tale endidThe Sonne fro the South
                    side is discendid…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…Beth fructuous and that in litle spaceAnd to do wele god send
                    you his grace
Bod414.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth the prolog of þe persons tale (f.
                    183v)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
By that the maunciple hadde his tale endedThe son fro þe
                    southe side is descended…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…Beth fructuose and that litul spaceAnd to done wele god sende
                    yow his grace
BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:
…And next biginneth / the Prolog of the Persones tale (f.
                        228v); The Persoun (RT); Here endeth the Prologg of the Persones
                    tale And next / biginneth the Persones tale (f. 229)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
BI þat þe manciple had his tale enditÞe sonne fro
                    þe souþe line is descendit…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…Beth fructuous and þat in litil spaceAnd to do wel god
                    sende you grace

OxfChrCh152.First Lines:
By that the yeman hadde this tale al endedThe sonne fro the south
                    lyne was descended…
OxfChrCh152.Last Lines:
…Beeth fructious and that in litel spaceAnd to do wele god
                    send yow his grace

OxfCCC198.First Lines:
By þat þe maunciple hadde his tale endedThe sonne fro
                    þe souþ syde
line is descended…
OxfCCC198.Last Lines:
…That I wol stonde to correcciounvppon þis word we han
                    assented sone…
OxfCCC198.Attributed Title:

                            Cam xxiiijm (f. 261, margin)

CULGg427.First Lines:
BY that the Manciple hadde his tale I endidThe sunne from the south
                    lyne was descendid…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…Or art a Persoun sey soth by thyn feyBe what thow be ne breke
                    thow nat oure pley…
CULGg427.Attributed Title:
…And here folwyn / the wordys of chaucer to the host (f.
                        398v)

             “Introduction.” 
             Poetical Works. Geoffrey Chaucer. A Facsimile of Cambridge University

CULIi326.First Lines:
BE that tyme the maunciple had his tale endidThe sonne from the
                    southe is so dissendid…
CULIi326.Last Lines:
…Bethe fructuouse and that in litle spaceAnd forto do wele god
                    sende vs grace
CULIi326.Attributed Title:
…And next begynneth the persons Prologe (f. 223); Persone (RT); Here
                    endeth the persons prologe / And here begynneth his tale (f. 224)

CULMm25.First Lines:

                    þe southe is descendede…
CULMm25.Last Lines:

CamFitzMc181.First Lines:
[B]Y that the mauncypull had his tale endedThe sonne fro the south
                    syde ys descended…
CamFitzMc181.Last Lines:
…Telle quod he your meditacounAnd hasteth you þe sonne
                    goth a doun

CamMagPep2006.First Lines:
By that the Maunciple hadde his tale alle endedThe sonne fro the
                    southe lyne was descended…
CamMagPep2006.Last Lines:
…Beth fructvous in that lytelle spaceAnd to do welle god sende
                    yow his grace
CamMagPep2006.Note:

                        Melibee and the Parson’s Prologue and
                    Tale.
